All Classes and Interfaces|All Packages|Constant Field Values

S

setInputFieldsToContentOfSelectedAppointment(Appointments) - Method in class controller.ModifyAppointmentController
This method sets all of the input fields (text fields, combo boxes, radio buttons, etc.) on the Modify Appointment screen to reflect the values of the appointment record in the Appointments TableView that the user selected.
setInputFieldsToContentOfSelectedCustomer(Customers) - Method in class controller.ModifyCustomerController
This method sets all of the input fields (text fields, combo boxes, etc.) on the Modify Customer screen to reflect the values of the customer record that the user selected in the Customers TableView (while they were still on the Customers Table screen, prior to clicking the "Modify" button on that same screen).
setTimeZoneLabelInAppropriateLanguage(ZoneId, Locale, boolean) - Method in interface controller.LoginScreenController.TimeZoneLabelSetter
This method is an abstract method that currently does not do anything (does not have a body); however, it will be overridden (in the "initialize()" method) such that it has the ability to set the Time Zone label to the user's current time zone (in the appropriate language).
signInButton - Variable in class controller.LoginScreenController
This is the button that users click in order to sign in (after they have entered their username and password).
signInLabel - Variable in class controller.LoginScreenController
This is the header displayed on the Login Screen; it reads "SIGN IN".
signOutButton - Variable in class controller.AddAppointmentController
Brings the user back to the Login Screen (if the user clicks the button) without creating a new appointment.
signOutButton - Variable in class controller.AddCustomerController
Brings the user back to the Login Screen (if the user clicks the button) without saving any of the user input (from the Add Customer screen).
signOutButton - Variable in class controller.AppointmentsTableController
The "Sign Out" button on the Appointments Table page, which leads the user back to the Login Screen.
signOutButton - Variable in class controller.CustomersTableController
The "Sign Out" button on the Customers Table page, which leads the user back to the Login Screen.
signOutButton - Variable in class controller.MainMenuController
 
signOutButton - Variable in class controller.ModifyAppointmentController
Brings the user back to the Login Screen (if the user clicks the button) without updating the appointment.
signOutButton - Variable in class controller.ModifyCustomerController
Brings the user back to the Login Screen (if the user clicks the button) without saving any of the user input (from the Modify Customer screen).
start(Stage) - Method in class customerappointmentsapplication.CustomerAppointmentsApplication
This is the JavaFX life cycle method that starts up the application.
startDateLabel - Variable in class controller.AddAppointmentController
This is the header text that precedes the Date Picker that is used to indicate the new appointment's start date.
startDateLabel - Variable in class controller.ModifyAppointmentController
This is the header text that precedes the Date Picker that is used to indicate the appointment's start date.
startTimeLabel - Variable in class controller.AddAppointmentController
This is the header text that precedes the appointment start time text field.
startTimeLabel - Variable in class controller.ModifyAppointmentController
This is the header text that precedes the appointment start time text field.
statisticsButton - Variable in class controller.AppointmentsTableController
The "Statistics" button on the Appointments Table page, which shows the user the three appointment-related statistical reports that were generated.
streetAddress - Variable in class model.Customers
The street address of this customer.
streetAddressLabel - Variable in class controller.AddCustomerController
This is the header text that precedes the customer street address field.
streetAddressLabel - Variable in class controller.ModifyCustomerController
This is the header text that precedes the customer street address field.
switchToDifferentSceneAndSendDataToThatSceneUsingButton(FXMLLoader, ActionEvent) - Method in class model.DataHolder
This method switches the current visible screen to the FXML file (UI screen) that is loaded up in the FXMLLoader (the first parameter of this method); this method only works if the event that triggered the screen switch came from a button.
switchToDifferentSceneAndSendDataToThatSceneUsingTextField(FXMLLoader, ActionEvent) - Method in class model.DataHolder
This method switches the current visible screen to the FXML file (UI screen) that is loaded up in the FXMLLoader (the first parameter of this method); this method only works if the event that triggered the screen switch came from a text field (for example, if the user's cursor was in a certain text field, and they then hit the "Enter" key on their keyboard).
switchToDifferentSceneUsingButton(String, ActionEvent) - Method in class model.DataHolder
This method switches the current visible screen to the FXML file (UI screen) indicated in the first parameter; this method only works if the event that triggered the screen switch came from a button.
switchToDifferentSceneUsingTextField(String, ActionEvent) - Method in class model.DataHolder
This method switches the current visible screen to the FXML file (UI screen) indicated in the first parameter; this method only works if the event that triggered the screen switch came from a text field (for example, if the user's cursor was in a certain text field, and they then hit the "Enter" key on their keyboard).
